statement.p: In 70 of the last 20 days it rained. How many days did it not rain? days

solution.p: We recall that a percent as a decimal is part/whole. Here that is \displaystyle\frac{{P}}{{20}}={0.7}. We solve for P by multiplying by \displaystyle{20}. \displaystyle{P}={0.7}\cdot{20}={14}. This is the number of days that it rained. We want the non-rainy days which is 20-14=6 We round that as requested to 6.
